item.title: Starting a Kafka Connect sink connector at the end of a topic
item.description: When you create a sink connector in Kafka Connect, by default it will start reading from the beginning of the topic and stream all of the existing—and new—data to the target. The setting that controls this behaviour is auto.offset.reset, and you can see its value in the worker log when the connector runs: [2019-08-05 23:31:35,405] INFO ConsumerConfig values: allow.auto.create.topics = true auto.commit.interval.ms = 5000 auto.offset.reset = earliest … If you want Kafka Connect to start reading from the end of the topic instead, you need to set auto.
